alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 01 at 8:01AM CDT until June 04 at 9:23AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wichita KS has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas... Verdigris River at Independence affecting Wilson and Montgomery Counties. Verdigris River at Coffeyville affecting Montgomery County. For the Verdigris River...including Altoona, Independence, Coffeyville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Verdigris River at Coffeyville. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon to late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Outside the levee system, the intersection of River Road and Stark Street floods. Flood waters expand to 1/4 of mile eastward on Stark Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 3.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 21.8 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Verdigris River Coffeyville 18.0 3.3 Wed 6 am CDT 14.6 21.8 6.0 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
